text: Justin Trudeau’s tax hikes and reckless spending have pushed everyday Canadians further behind. He may not understand that people are really struggling but Conservatives do. We will always fight to help all Canadians get the opportunities they need to succeed.pic.twitter.com/kW7hbJLvz4

Les hausses d’impôts et les dépenses irresponsables de Justin Trudeau font reculer les Canadiens. Peut-être ne comprend-il pas que les gens peinent. Les conservateurs comprennent. Nous nous battons pour offrir aux Canadiens les possibilités nécessaires pour réussir.pic.twitter.com/kYiuZ7aenp

This is heartbreaking. Praying for those injured in this antisemitic attack during Hanukkah. Canada’s Conservatives stand with Jewish communities around the world in condemning hate.https://twitter.com/CBCAlerts/status/1211242016413274113 …

C'est horrible. Nous prions pour les blessés de cette attaque antisémite durant Hanoukka. Les conservateurs du Canada soutiennent les communautés juives du monde entier et dénonceront toujours les crimes haineux.https://twitter.com/CBCAlerts/status/1211242016413274113 …

Les conservateurs ont un bilan solide de défense du Canada sur la scène mondiale. Avec notre motion pour établir un comité spécial sur les relations sino-canadiennes, nous aiderons les Canadiens à obtenir la transparence et la responsabilité qu’ils méritent du gouvernement.pic.twitter.com/70KTuLYCTX

Conservatives have a strong record of standing up for Canada on the world stage. With our motion to strike a special committee on Canada-China relations, we will help Canadians get the transparency and accountability they deserve from their government.pic.twitter.com/qEvx4X8zRQ

Le mois dernier, 71 000 Canadiens ont perdu leur emploi et l’économie canadienne faiblit. Le gouvernement libéral doit agir pour relancer l’économie plutôt que de nuire à nos possibilités par des impôts trop élevés et des règlements qui n’en finissent plus.pic.twitter.com/3ZG7BN8uCX

Last month 71,000 Canadians lost their jobs and the Canadian economy is teetering. The Liberal government must take action to grow our economy rather than stripping opportunities away with high taxes and endless regulation.pic.twitter.com/dpwwqiXMzl
Our Conservative team understands that the disunity happening in Canada is severe. We will continue to fight to keep Canada strong and united.pic.twitter.com/utVtsubQHM
Notre équipe conservatrice comprend que la crise de l’unité canadienne est sérieuse. Nous allons continuer de nous battre pour unifier et fortifier le Canada.pic.twitter.com/a2CR8Lba2f

The damage done to Canada’s national unity over the past four years has been significant. Conservatives will work hard to help unite everyone. Not divide them. Let’s get Canadians back to work in regions that are struggling.pic.twitter.com/3nETBFKP16

Au cours des quatre dernières années, l’unité nationale a été considérablement endommagée. Les conservateurs travaillent fort pour unifier les gens au lieu de les diviser. Aidons les Canadiens à retourner au travail dans les régions éprouvées.pic.twitter.com/fQsQiLMeJ3

Les conservateurs du Canada se concentrent sur les aspirations de tous les Canadiens. Nous savons que le coût de la vie augmente et nous continuerons à présenter de vraies idées concrètes pour vous aider et aider vos familles.pic.twitter.com/ID170PZC7H

Canada’s Conservatives are focused on the aspirations of all Canadians. We know life is getting more expensive and we will continue to present real and tangible ideas to help you and your family.pic.twitter.com/VWYNOAjE3k

Our Conservative motion to create a committee on Canada-China relations passed, despite the Liberals voting against it. We are fighting hard for all Canadians and standing up for our national interests.pic.twitter.com/8VPqi6Q62I

Notre motion conservatrice pour établir un comité spécial sur les relations sino-canadiennes a été adoptée, malgré l’opposition libérale. Nous nous battons pour tous les Canadiens et défendons nos intérêts nationaux.pic.twitter.com/nZeGtvN5Rj

If Justin Trudeau wants to seriously revive the economy, an easy solution is within his reach: Cut taxes. People are struggling to get by as life gets more expensive and Conservatives have a plan.pic.twitter.com/TjItMtNP5X

Si Justin Trudeau cherche sérieusement à relancer l’économie, une solution toute simple s’offre à lui : alléger le fardeau fiscal. Le coût de la vie augmente et les gens ont du mal à joindre les deux bouts. Les conservateurs ont un plan.pic.twitter.com/Lh9Gm8w0Lv
Souvenirs, souvenirs. Beaux #souvenirs d’enfance à Noël avec ma famille il y a des années. pic.twitter.com/H1M8hHbxtN
Taking a trip down memory lane. #Throwback to great childhood memories of Christmas time with my family many years ago. pic.twitter.com/71ikoammZP

Christmas is the time to celebrate the birth of Jesus and the hope and joy that Christ brings. We’re also celebrating family, friendship, giving, and gratitude. From my family to yours, have a very Merry Christmas! My statement: https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/2338299056500889/ …pic.twitter.com/pKaXTXocd0

Noël souligne la célébration de la naissance de Jésus ainsi que de l’espoir et de la joie que le Christ apporte. Nous célébrons aussi la famille, l’amitié, le don de soi et la gratitude. De ma famille à la vôtre : un très joyeux Noël! Ma déclaration : https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/1189224387953521/ …pic.twitter.com/o0v11s06ml
Are you grabbing some popcorn and watching a Christmas movie with your family tonight? Here are my top five favourites! pic.twitter.com/d10GJHRY5f
Vous faites une soirée popcorn et films avec la famille ? Voici mes cinq préférés ! pic.twitter.com/MzdZAeYGLg
Un très joyeux Noël de ma famille à la vôtre! pic.twitter.com/yKSU7vN08S
Merry Christmas from my family to yours! pic.twitter.com/0jaB8ZLocu

There was more candy and icing eaten than what actually ended up on the gingerbread houses. It was to be expected. Enjoying quality family time with my family this Christmas.pic.twitter.com/Sz5QFBTVhN

Nous avons mangé plus de glaçage et de bonbons que ce qui s’est vraiment trouvé sur les maisons en pain d’épice. Il fallait s’y attendre. Je profite du temps de qualité en famille ce Noël.pic.twitter.com/9nfS3zyMck
Gingerbread house decorating with four kids? Challenge accepted! We had so much fun creating our gingerbread houses! What’s one of your favourite family traditions? pic.twitter.com/WzzlOKz0Lz

Décorer une maison en pain d’épice avec quatre enfants? Tout un défi! Et nous l’avons relevé! Nous avons eu tellement de plaisir à décorer nos maisons en pain d’épice! Quelles sont vos traditions familiales préférées? pic.twitter.com/cyV533fMe9

I would like to extend my warmest wishes to all Jewish Canadians and to our Jewish friends all around the world who begin the celebration of Hanukkah this evening. Chag Hanukkah Sameach! My statement: https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/2242877989345277/ …pic.twitter.com/EO4jBz2ilz

Je tiens à transmettre tous mes vœux aux Juifs canadiens et à nos amis juifs partout dans le monde, qui commencent à célébrer Hanoukka ce soir. Chag Hanukkah Sameach! Ma déclaration: https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/471246086845847/ …pic.twitter.com/vCNWPW5zan

It is now clear that Justin Trudeau intends to raise the carbon tax. He needs to finally come clean with Canadians and tell us how much more expensive life is going to get. Canadians cannot afford another tax hike.pic.twitter.com/rJuAMCut9S

Il est maintenant clair que Justin Trudeau veut augmenter la taxe sur le carbone. Il doit être honnête avec les Canadiens et avouer de combien le coût de la vie va augmenter. Les Canadiens ne peuvent pas se permettre une nouvelle hausse des impôts.pic.twitter.com/jClQoKKo8A

Yesterday we found further proof that the Liberal carbon tax isn’t revenue neutral. There is a huge cost to just implementing it. That means more money for bureaucrats and less in the pockets of hardworking Canadians.pic.twitter.com/VnMHSMXFXm

Hier, nous avons encore une fois eu la preuve que la taxe sur le carbone des libéraux compromettra les revenus. Des sommes colossales sont requises pour la mettre en œuvre. Ce qui veut dire plus d’argent pour les fonctionnaires et moins dans les poches des travailleurs canadiens.pic.twitter.com/N0lncouojx

Tragic to learn of the passing of @SeanFraserMP’s newborn daughter, Ruth Caroline Burton Fraser. My deepest condolences and prayers are with him, his wife Sarah and daughter Molly. Jill and I cannot imagine your pain with this loss and we stand with you in this tragic time.

Thinking of our friends in New Zealand as they mourn those lost on White Island in the volcano eruption this morning. We are praying for the friends and loved ones of those who were killed or injured in this tragedy.

Bringing one of the original copies of the Magna Carta to Canada in 2015 for public display in our Parliament was a powerful reminder for all Parliamentarians on the limits of state power and to respect the freedom of citizens: http://www.cpac.ca/en/programs/public-record/episodes/90004882 … 2/2

On this day the Magna Carta was signed in 1215. An important step in protecting the people from the abuse of executive power. It also helped establish the principle that no one is above the law, no matter one's wealth, position or family name. 1/2

L'arrivée d'un des exemplaires originaux de la Magna Carta au Canada en 2015 pour affichage public au Parlement a été un puissant rappel pour tous les parlementaires des limites du pouvoir de l'État et du respect de la liberté des citoyens: http://www.cpac.ca/en/programs/public-record/episodes/90004882 … 2/2

En ce jour la Magna Carta a été signée en 1215. Un pas important pour protéger les gens contre le pouvoir abusif. Elle a aussi aidé à établir le principe que personne n'est au-dessus de la loi, peu importe sa richesse, sa position ou son nom de famille. 1/2

La santé mentale nous touche tous directement ou indirectement. De nombreuses personnes surmontent la stigmatisation pour parler de leur expérience personnelle. Partager est le meilleur moyen pour aider et motiver ceux qui luttent. Il faut #ParlerHautEtFort de la santé mentale.
Any Liberal who says I will reduce the child benefit is spreading falsehoods. Conservatives created the child benefit. As Prime Minister, I will continue to protect it. (2/2)

Conservatives introduced the child benefit. Liberals opposed it, saying parents would blow the money on “beer and popcorn.” Happy the Liberals have flip-flopped. As Prime Minister, I will protect the child benefit without raising taxes on parents like the Liberals have. (1/2)

Les conservateurs ont créé l’allocation pour enfant. Les libéraux ont dit que les parents la gaspilleraient pour de la bière et du popcorn. Content de voir qu’ils changent d’idée. Comme PM, je protégerai l’allocation pour enfant sans augmenter les impôts des parents. (1/2)

Canada's total debt will reach an all-time high of $705 billion this year or $54,865 per Canadian family. Justin Trudeau was telling Canadians falsehoods about his fiscal plan during the last election and I certainly don’t believe what he’s saying now. 5/n

By the end of this year, Justin Trudeau will have increased federal debt by 5.6% per person—the largest increase of any prime minister in Canadian history who didn’t govern during a world war or recession. 4/n

He looked Canadians in the eyes and promised to balance the budget in 2019 - but the budget will have a $4.3 BILLION bigger deficit than what Justin Trudeau said back in March - and it will hit $19.8 billion. 3/n
That’s not how Canadians manage their households, leaving a huge credit card bill to their kids, and that’s definitely not what Canadians expect of their government. 2/n
Justin Trudeau has blown through a surplus left behind by Conservatives – leaving massive deficits year after year for the next generation of Canadians to pay back. 1/n

Happy Louis Riel Day! As a Canadian politician of Métis background, Louis Riel was the driving force behind the creation of Manitoba as a new Canadian province. Today, Manitobans will honour his life’s work and pause to reflect on the province’s proud history.

Joyeux Jour de Louis Riel! Politicien d’origine métisse, Louis Riel a été la force motrice de la création du Manitoba comme nouvelle province canadienne. Aujourd’hui, les Manitobains rendent hommage au travail de sa vie et se souviennent fièrement de l’histoire de la province.

En cette Journée du patrimoine en Nouvelle-Écosse, les gens rendent hommage aux personnes, endroits et événements qui ont forgé leur patrimoine. Ils créent un héritage durable. Toute la population prend le temps aujourd’hui de célébrer son histoire, sa culture et son avenir!

On Nova Scotia Heritage Day, Nova Scotians honour the extraordinary people, places and events that helped shape their rich heritage. Nova Scotia and its people have left a lasting legacy. I hope all Nova Scotians take time to celebrate their history, and their bright future!

C’est l’Île en fête! L’Île-du-Prince-Édouard se réunit aujourd’hui pour célébrer l’amour de la famille. C’est une journée pour faire une pause et passer du temps avec ceux que nous aimons. J’espère que toutes les familles prennent le temps de se réunir, aujourd’hui et toujours.

Happy Islander Day! Prince Edward Islanders gather today to celebrate the love of family. It’s a day to put busy lives on hold and spend time with those who matter most. I hope all Islanders take the time to reconnect and appreciate their families today and always.

On Family Day, I hope you all get to hit pause on your busy lives to come together with loved ones. Jill and I are blessed to spend the day at home in Regina with the kids. Please take time today to appreciate the love of family. From my family to yours, Happy Family Day!

En cette Fête de la famille, nous faisons tous une pause pour être avec les gens que nous aimons. Jill et moi avons le plaisir de passer cette journée chez nous à Regina avec les enfants. Prenez le temps d’apprécier l’amour irremplaçable de la famille. Bonne Fête de la famille!

Budgets don’t balance themselves. And huge deficits and mounting debt don’t mean we’re ready to withstand a recession. The bigger our deficits today, the higher our taxes tomorrow. Canada can’t afford this kind of economic ineptitude. Let’s make a change next year! (7/7)

Before the global recession, from 2006 to 2008, the Conservative government paid down $37 billion in debt. This allowed us to come out of the crisis faster and with stronger growth than any other G7 country. (6/n)

The bottom line is that when the downturn hits - as it inevitably will - the cupboard will be bare and our ability to recover will be severely weakened. If the PM doesn’t understand this, we are in more trouble than we imagined. (5/n)

And that is before the government spends a penny on extra economic stimulus. Liberals complained the previous Conservative government’s $50B stimulus was too cheap, so you can imagine what Trudeau would do. (4/n)

Finance Canada estimates that a 1% drop in real GDP growth will take a $5B chunk out of the budget. That means if you start with a $19B deficit - and a recession like 2009 hits - the deficit could reach $40B. (3/n)

When a recession hits, deficits soar. Government revenues fall because people are earning less and paying less taxes. Spending on EI and other social programs surges. This is Public Finances 101. (2/n)

I’ve seen a lot of comments on Justin Trudeau’s answer to this question. Some are likening it to his infamous “the budget will balance itself” remark. But it’s worse. Here’s why: (1/n)https://twitter.com/ctvqp/status/1074343752918073344 …

Les budgets ne s’équilibrent pas seuls. Les déficits et les dettes qui s’accumulent ne nous préparent pas à une récession. Plus notre déficit gonfle, plus nos impôts seront élevés demain. Le Canada ne peut pas se permettre cela. En 2019, faisons un changement! (7/7)

Avant la récession mondiale de 2006 à 2008, le gouvernement conservateur a réduit la dette de 37 milliards. Cela nous a permis de sortir plus rapidement et plus forts de la crise que tout autre pays du G7. (6/n)

Le résultat est qu’au moment inévitable du ralentissement, le portefeuille sera vide et notre capacité de récupération sera grandement affaiblie. Si ce PM ne le comprend pas, nous sommes plus à risque que nous aurions pu l’imaginer. (5/n)

Cela avant que le gouvernement ne verse un seul dollar sur la relance de l’économie. Les libéraux se sont plaints que le programme de relance de 50 milliards de dollars du gouvernement conservateur précédent était insuffisant. Imaginez ce que Trudeau pourrait faire. (4/n)

Finances Canada estime qu’une baisse de 1% de la croissance du PIB réel coûtera 5 milliards de dollars au budget. Cela signifie que si vous démarrez avec un déficit de 19 milliards et qu’une récession frappe comme en 2009, le déficit pourrait atteindre 40 milliards. (3/n)

Quand une récession frappe, les déficits gonflent. Les revenus du gouvernement chutent puisque les gens gagnent moins et paient moins d’impôt. Les dépenses sur l’AE et d’autres programmes sociaux grimpent. #FinancesPubliques101. (2/n)

On behalf of Canada’s Conservatives and the Scheer family, I wish the Bush family, their loved ones, and the American people my heartfelt condolences on the loss of President George H. W. Bush. 6/6
He was truly a gentleman of American politics and one of the world’s most principled defenders of freedom and democracy. 5/6

Alongside Prime Minister Brian Mulroney, he also laid the groundwork for the Canada-US Free Trade Agreement which has led to one of the largest and most prosperous trading relationships in the world. 4/6
President Bush was also instrumental in confronting the evils of communism and bringing the Cold War to an end. 3/6

He was a Naval aviator, UN Ambassador, CIA Director, Congressman, Vice-President, and President. His decades-long record service is both his lasting legacy to his country and a benchmark of sacrifice and patriotism to which all public servants should aspire. 2/6

Jill and I were saddened to hear the news of President George H. W. Bush’s passing. A great friend to Canada, he served his country in nearly every capacity, both as an elected official and a military and intelligence public servant. 1/6

Au nom des conservateurs du Canada et de la famille Scheer, je souhaite à la famille Bush, à ses proches et au peuple américain mes plus sincères condoléances pour la perte du président George H. W. Bush. 7/7
C’était un véritable gentleman de la politique américaine et l’un des plus grands défenseurs de la liberté et de la démocratie. 6/7

Aux côtés du premier ministre Brian Mulroney, il a aussi jeté les fondations de l’Accord de libre-échange Canada-États-Unis, l’une des relations commerciales les plus importantes et les plus prospères du monde. 5/7
Le président Bush a aussi joué un rôle clé pour contrer le mal du communisme et mettre fin à la Guerre froide. 4/7
Ses états de service pendant des décennies sont à la fois un héritage durable pour son pays et un exemple de sacrifice et de patriotisme auquel tous les représentants élus devraient aspirer. 3/7
Il a été aviateur naval, ambassadeur aux Nations Unies, directeur de la CIA, membre du Congrès, vice-président et président. 2/7

Jill et moi sommes attristés d’apprendre le décès du président George H. W. Bush. Grand ami du Canada, il a servi son pays à pratiquement toutes les fonctions, à la fois comme représentant élu, militaire et membre du renseignement. 1/7

Canada should have been guided by that spirit in 1939. Canada should have offered sanctuary to the passengers of the MS St. Louis. For our failure to do so then, we stand with the Government today, in its apology. Never again, must “none be too many.” #StLouis

This past Saturday, Canadians filled synagogues across our country as part of the Show Up For Shabbat campaign. Jewish or not, all were welcomed by a community whose home in Canada pre-dates Confederation by more than a century. #StLouis

But every generation faces its own test; every generation must confront for itself the temptation of intolerance; every one of us must answer for ourselves the old question: How will we respond when we face that test? #StLouis
We are here today because in that crucial moment, when Canada was weighed in the balance, we were found wanting. #StLouis

As we witness this rise in anti-Semitism and other forms of intolerance and discrimination, we cannot again stand by impassively. We cannot again watch and fail to act, as ancient prejudice mutates into new violence. #StLouis

Today’s apology is not the first recognition of this stain on our national record. In 2011, under our previous Conservative government, these events were commemorated by the unveiling of a memorial at the Canadian Museum of Immigration at Pier 21 in Halifax. #StLouis

And we know from painful experience, that where anti-Semitism is tolerated, anti-Jewish violence follows. This was brought home again, achingly, in the murderous attack at Pittsburgh’s Tree of Life Synagogue, only days ago. #StLouis
On social media, in parades and public demonstrations, and even on our university campuses, we have seen a disturbing resurgence and even normalization, of anti-Semitic rhetoric. #StLouis

Anti-Semitism is not a relic of the 30s. It wasn't eradicated with the defeat of the Nazis. It is very much alive today. In Canada anti-Jewish crimes account for the largest share of religiously-motivated hate crimes, and the overall number has increased in recent years. #StLouis

This apology should not make us comfortable. On the contrary, it should grab us and shake us. It should be an alarm that jolts us out of our daily routines and demands that we look at our world today, through the lens of that experience. #StLouis
There is no diminishment of individual guilt in such a shared failure; we were responsible to the full extent of our own cold, deliberate and official inhumanity. #StLouis

To the passengers of the MS St. Louis, however, Canada was not geographically isolated or unreachable. It was not our lands, but our minds that were isolated; it was our hearts that were unreachable. And for that failure, we are profoundly sorry. #StLouis

It commands us to remember how, within the lifetime of many here in this room, a civilized, modern society succumbed to a primitive fear, and turned its vaunted industrial prowess against its Jewish citizens and its neighbours. #StLouis

The unique horror of the Holocaust, in which more than a quarter of the MS St. Louis’ passengers perished, produced the rallying cry: “Never Again”. That is not a passive hope. It is a call to action. #StLouis
And while it is true that an apology cannot change the past, occasions such as this, marked by remembrance, reflection, and regret, can help guide our future. #StLouis
It is a sign of a healthy society to be able to look at history clearly and see both the light and the dark; to celebrate our achievements, but also to mourn our failings. #StLouis

The unique horror of the Holocaust, in which more than a quarter of the MS St. Louis’ passengers perished, produced the rallying cry: “NEVER AGAIN.” That is not a passive hope. It is a call to action. 2/2

Conservatives will hold Justin Trudeau to account for his failure to gain anything significant for Canadians in these negotiations. 9/9
The items that Justin Trudeau has been quick to point to as a success for Canada, such as dispute resolution or cultural protection, are items that have existed for decades. They aren’t new. 8/n
Tariffs remain on steel, aluminum, and softwood lumber - with no timeline or plan for lifting them. 7/n
Buy American provisions remain, shutting out Canadian companies from bidding on American government contracts. 6/n
For all of these concessions to Donald Trump, Justin Trudeau was unable to win anything significant in return: 5/n
He backed down on pharmaceuticals, giving Donald Trump exactly what he wanted: Higher prices and bigger profits for American drug companies. 4/n
He backed down on dairy, giving Donald Trump exactly what he wanted: More market share for American exporters and less business for Canadians. 3/n
He backed down on automotives, giving Donald Trump exactly what he wanted: limits on how many cars Canada can export to the United States. 2/n
Justin Trudeau said he wanted to negotiate a better NAFTA deal with Donald Trump. There is virtually nothing in USMCA that puts Canada in a better position. 1/n
Les conservateurs vont demander des comptes à Justin Trudeau pour son échec à obtenir quelque chose de significatif pour les Canadiens dans ces négociations. 9/9

Les points que Justin Trudeau s’est empressé de présenter comme des gains pour le Canada, comme les mécanismes de résolution des conflits ou la protection culturelle, existaient déjà depuis des décennies. Rien de nouveau. 8/n
Les tarifs sur l’acier, l’aluminium et le bois d’œuvre restent – sans délai ni plan pour les éliminer. 7/n
Les dispositions “Buy American” restent, empêchant les entreprises canadiennes de soumissionner sur des appels d’offres du gouvernement américain. 6/n
Avec toutes ces concessions à Donald Trump, Justin Trudeau a été incapable d’obtenir quoi que ce soit de significatif en retour: 5/n

Il a fait marche arrière sur les produits pharmaceutiques, donnant à Donald Trump exactement ce qu’il voulait: des prix plus élevés et de meilleurs profits pour les sociétés pharmaceutiques américaines. 4/n

Il a fait marche arrière sur les produits laitiers, donnant à Donald Trump exactement ce qu’il voulait: une plus grande part de marché pour les exportations américaines et moins pour les entreprises canadiennes. 3/n
Il a fait marche arrière sur l’automobile, donnant à Donald Trump exactement ce qu’il voulait: limiter le nombre de voitures canadiennes que le Canada peut exporter aux États-Unis. 2/n
Justin Trudeau a dit qu’il voulait négocier un meilleur ALENA avec Donald Trump. Il n’y a pratiquement rien dans l’AEUMC qui améliore la position du Canada. 1/n

Canada’s Conservatives are strong, ready and here for Canada. #CPC18pic.twitter.com/tGvLQmlgEH
Les conservateurs du Canada sont forts, prêts et là pour le Canada. #PCC18pic.twitter.com/Ogg2W5eTlO
United. #CPC18pic.twitter.com/J1Dhs7k6Kr
Unis. #PCC18pic.twitter.com/hoBtUNIKdk
Ladies and gentlemen, this is my positive Conservative vision – Where taxes are low, government is limited, opportunity is unlimited, freedom is shared, and people are put before government!
Where we work with First Nations as partners in our shared prosperity, instead of talking down to them with empty gestures and symbolism.
This is what the Conservative Party will offer. A country where people aren’t just there to pay taxes to a big government, they’re there to be served by a good government.
What if we had a government that understood that a free people making free decisions was the best way to improve quality of life and create prosperity?
But as you’re out there, knocking on doors and talking to your neighbours, I want you to allow yourself to dream. To dream about the country we are building.

Conservatives know that people – all people, no matter where they live or what they do– are best served when governments stand down and allow individuals, families, and communities to determine their own destiny.

Nous sommes unis dans nos principes et notre but – en défendant vigoureusement contre les attaques envers nos libertés économiques et individuelles et offrant une vision du Canada où tout le monde peut réussir.
Ladies and gentlemen, Conservatives are united. Across provincial borders, conservatives are coming together and winning.

Ne laissez jamais personne vous dire que les valeurs conservatrices ne sont pas des valeurs québécoises. Mes amis, les conservateurs du Québec peuvent se présenter dans n’importe quelle région la tête haute.

Mes amis, je suis très confiant en vue des prochaines élections. Je suis sur le terrain partout et à l’écoute des Québécois. Les gens viennent vers nous. Ils veulent discuter avec nous. Ils sont intéressés par nos idées.
There is unity in our diversity.

There is absolutely nothing compassionate about allowing thousands of people to cross the border illegally from a safe place like upstate New York, jumping ahead of those in refugee camps fleeing violence and tyranny and waiting for Canada’s help.

Il n’y a rien de compatissant à menacer des millions d’emplois avec une attaque sans précédent contre les petites entreprises. Ou à étouffer les familles qui tentent de joindre les deux bouts avec plus d’impôts.
They try and convince people that they are moved by compassion. But we all know that there is nothing compassionate about their policies.
Liberals always try and wrap themselves up in good intentions, but their policies invariably hurt the very people they claim they want to help.
And that’s why, come 2019, my first act as Prime Minister will be to get rid of the carbon tax – once and for all!
There is a carbon tax revolt brewing. And I can tell you the reason more and more Canadians don’t support a carbon tax is precisely because we do understand it!

Kathleen Wynne and the Liberals in Ontario are gone – thank you Ford Nation. Jason Kenney and the UCP are about to take care of the NDP in Alberta. Even Liberals are running away from it. PEI’s Liberal government will submit a plan this fall that won’t include a carbon tax.
Now speaking of pointless gestures that will cost Canadians a lot of money and do nothing for the world’s climate… The carbon tax!

What Justin Trudeau doing is robbing from our and it’s just wrong. Under my leadership, the deficits will come to an end. We will balance the budget and once again and put Canada’s fiscal house in order.

Every year that we’re in a deficit, we’re borrowing money from my kids and from yours. Deficits today mean higher taxes tomorrow. It really is that simple. Not one of us – not a single one of us in this room – would leave a credit card bill to those who come after us.
Quand je serai premier ministre, les contribuables québécois ne rempliront qu’un seul rapport d’impôt comme l’ensemble des Canadiens.

In October, I’m headed to India to do the same. And don’t worry, I don’t dance and I’m not bringing a celebrity chef. The point is, international trade is a serious endeavor requiring serious leadership. It’s time for the grown-ups to be in charge again.

We need to stop pumping cheap fuel into the American economy. We need to get our resources to new markets. And we need to compete with other countries on taxation and regulation instead of rolling over.
Under Justin Trudeau, Canada’s international trading prospects have never looked more grim. And that’s a problem, when one in five Canadian jobs rely on free trade.

Ladies and gentlemen, this kind of out-of-touch, elitist thinking is typical Liberal arrogance. Millionaire Liberals like Justin Trudeau may want to pay higher gas prices, but the hard-working Canadians that we are fighting for don't!

Depuis que les libéraux ont gagné en deux mille quinze, plus de quatre-vingts pour cent des Canadiens de la classe moyenne paient plus d’impôt, pour une augmentation moyenne de plus de huit cents dollars.

Les Canadiens et les Canadiennes, partout au pays, me disent qu’ils se demandent vraiment si leur avenir sera meilleur. En fait, plus de la moitié des Canadiens sont tous les mois à deux cents près de ne pas être capable de payer leurs factures ou leurs prêts.
As Prime Minister, I’m going to make sure the government takes less money off every paycheque so you can get ahead, not just get by.

From coast to coast I hear the same thing. People are getting by, but they aren’t getting ahead. There’s only a little left at the end of the month. And everything keeps getting more expensive. But Justin Trudeau doesn’t get it.

The tax-hiking, rule-breaking, perk-loving, deficit-spending, debt-mounting, virtue-signalling Liberals Canadians have come to know and despise. Justin Trudeau says Canada is back? I say the Liberals are back.

A year ago when I met people, it was a polite handshake, a smile, and a “best of luck.” Now it’s the two-hand grasp, the serious square look in the eye, and a “Andrew, you just have to beat these guys.”

If we look back on our history and our leaders and only see the blemishes, we miss out on a beautiful story of a country that has progressed into one of the safest, freest, and most prosperous in the world.
I think it’s a disgrace that some are allowing extreme voices in this country to erase our proud heritage.
Il ne se passe pas un jour sans que je me sente humblement privilégié de diriger ce parti et de suivre les traces des grands leaders conservateurs.

Mesdames et Messieurs, comme l’histoire de notre parti le montre clairement, les conservateurs gagnent quand nous appliquons nos principes les plus forts et les plus fondamentaux aux problèmes modernes auxquels les Canadiens et les Canadiennes font face.
That, right there, is Canada, ladies and gentlemen. And it’s worth fighting to protect.

This country that has bestowed such fortune and opportunity on my family that I stand before you running to be the next Prime Minister one generation removed from having nine kids in a two-bedroom bungalow along a dirt road.

To raise my three daughters and two sons with the same strength and optimism she showed me. To give of myself so the burdens of others might be lighter. Just as she did her whole life. That is her legacy to our family. I want it to be my legacy to this country.

My mother was my hero. She passed away last year – right before I was elected leader. But I like to think she passed away knowing that she instilled in me a lasting obligation to make life even just a little bit better for the people around me.

But here’s the real problem. Justin Trudeau has no idea what she or any middle class Canadian family is going through because of him. He has no concept of how to stretch a dollar. How to make it to the next payday. How to stick to a monthly budget.

Folks, this weekend is about a lot of things. It’s about celebrating how far we’ve come in the last year. It’s about affirming our principles and articulating our vision. But most importantly, it’s about all the people we fight for every single day.
Et si nous restons unis. Si nous continuons de travailler fort, Si nous demeurons fidèles à nos principes. Dans quelques mois, le chemin des victoires conservatrices va traverser tout le pays!

C’est le travail acharné de toute notre équipe qui a contribué à cette victoire historique au Saguenay. Je suis tellement fier d’avoir dans notre famille le nouveau député de Chicoutimi-Le Fjord, Richard Martel!
If we can win a fair fight on our principles in Chicoutimi-Le Fjord, there is nowhere in this country we can’t win!
Nous gagnons la lutte contre la taxe sur le carbone, nous nous battons pour le libre-échange, nous soutenons une immigration légale et ordonnée, et nous défendons l’équilibre budgétaire.
Et je n’ai jamais été plus honoré, plus fier ou plus content de diriger ce grand parti. J’attends ce week-end depuis longtemps. Et vous aussi, je le sais.
Mais par-dessus tout, merci à chacun d’entre vous d’être à Halifax ce week-end. Je sais que nombre d’entre vous avez fait un long trajet et dépensé beaucoup d’argent pour être ici.

Thank you to the dozens of conservative leaders and elected officials from all parts of the country who are here. We are certainly one big, strong, united, national Conservative party. And next year, we will be a strong, stable, national Conservative majority government.

Instead of demonizing his critics, Justin Trudeau should confront the problem. This requires courage and leadership, and if Justin Trudeau can’t summon it, Canada’s Conservatives are strong and ready under my leadership. 5/5
This is a calculated Liberal strategy to avoid accountability and shut down legitimate criticism of their appalling record. 4/5

This is how you can tell when Liberals are losing. Concerned about illegal border crossers? You’re a racist. Worried about the cost? You’re un-Canadian. Don’t like the carbon tax? You’re a denier. Canadians are sick and tired of this. 3/5
This is not the first time Trudeau has responded to criticism with demonizing attacks. 2/5

By sweeping away legitimate questions on his failed border policy with vile personal insults, it is Trudeau himself who is guilty of polarizing the debate. No one has done more to divide Canadians than he has. 1/5

Au lieu de dénigrer ses critiques, Justin Trudeau devrait affronter le problème. Il faut du courage et du leadership. Si Justin Trudeau ne les a pas, les conservateurs du Canada sont forts et prêts sous mon leadership. 5/5
Il y a une stratégie libérale calculée pour éviter la responsabilisation et faire taire les critiques légitimes sur leur bilan épouvantable. 4/5

C’est comme ça qu’on sait quand les libéraux sont en train de perdre. Préoccupé des passages à la frontière? Vous êtes raciste. Préoccupé du coût? Vous êtes anti Canadien. Vous n’aimez pas la taxe sur le carbone? Vous êtes dans le déni. C’est assez. 3/5
Ce n’est pas la première fois que Trudeau répond aux critiques par des attaques dénigrantes. 2/5

En évitant toutes les questions légitimes sur sa politique d’échec à la frontière par des insultes personnelles ignobles, Trudeau polarise lui-même le débat. Personne ne fait plus que lui pour diviser les Canadiens. 1/5

When it does, Justin Trudeau should tell us himself, instead of waiting for the facts to come out from American regulators. 6/6

So somewhere in the neighbourhood of $14 billion of Canadian tax dollars are now on the line. You’ll excuse my skepticism that the Trudeau Liberals will hold to that number. We should only expect it to go up. 5/n
And *that* $9.3 billion is on top of the $4.5 billion Canadians are already on the hook for just to purchase the existing pipeline. 4/n
Remember, this new $1.9 billion is on top of the $7.4 billion Trans Mountain had previously estimated the expansion would cost. This brings the potential construction cost to $9.3 billion. 3/n

Canadians only learned about this from journalists reading Kinder Morgan’s filings with the SEC. Justin Trudeau is reaching into our wallets to buy a pipeline. We should find out the true cost of it from him – not from digging through company documents on a US Gov't website. 2/n

Yesterday it came to light that that building the Trans Mountain expansion might cost $1.9 billion extra and take a year longer than previously scheduled. This is crazy, of course, but there’s something else I find disturbing: 1/n
Quand il augmentera, Justin Trudeau devrait nous le dire lui-même, au lieu d’attendre que les faits viennent d’organismes de réglementation américains. 6/6
Donc environ 14 milliards de dollars d’impôt canadiens sont en jeu. Permettez-moi de douter que les libéraux de Trudeau vont s’en tenir à ce chiffre. Il devrait certainement augmenter. 5/n
Et *ces* 9,3 milliards $s’ajoutent aux 4,5 milliards $que les Canadiens doivent déjà payer juste pour l’achat du pipeline existant. 4/n
N’oublions pas que ce 1,9 milliard $s’ajoute aux 7,4 milliards $déjà estimés par Trans Mountain pour l’expansion. Cela porte le coût de construction potentiel à 9,3 milliards $. 3/n

Les Canadiens l’ont appris de journalistes qui ont lu les documents de Kinder Morgan. Trudeau vide vos portefeuilles pour acheter un pipeline. Il devrait lui-même nous dire le coût réel, pas des gens qui consultent des documents sur un site Web du gouvernement américain. 2/n

Nous avons appris hier que la construction du pipeline Trans Mountain pourrait coûter 1,9 milliard $de plus et durer plus longtemps que prévu. C’est fou, bien sûr, mais une autre chose est troublante. 1/n

Let me get this straight… Justin Trudeau is giving big business a special deal because his Carbon Tax will have such negative consequences, but small businesses and working families have to suck it up. #TrudeauLogichttps://twitter.com/DanAlbas/status/1024730178264608768 …

My first act as Prime Minister will be to repeal Justin Trudeau’s Carbon Tax. Canada needs to be open for business. We need to create jobs and opportunity for Canadians everywhere. And together, we can do just that. 10/10

Justin Trudeau’s failed policies have made it more difficult to do business and create jobs in Canada. As a result, a large ‘Closed’ sign now hangs on a country that was once one of the very best places in the world to do business. 9/n

Trudeau has also created massive regulatory uncertainty, he has increased taxes on payroll, he has introduced – and make no mistake, will still impose a new Carbon Tax – and is running massive generational deficits. 8/n
Canada’s competitiveness problem is a direct result of Justin Trudeau’s failed economic policies, of which the Carbon Tax is unfortunately just one example. 7/n

The reality (of course) is that the Trudeau Carbon Tax is bad for everyone. It makes Canada a less a competitive place to do business, whether your company employs five people or 50,000. It makes life more expensive for individuals and families. 6/n

Yet he still plans to impose his Carbon Tax on smaller businesses and families in full force. This makes no sense. The Trudeau Carbon Tax cannot be harmful for big business while simultaneously be helpful for small business and families. But this is now Trudeau’s position. 5/n
Today Trudeau is acknowledging that Conservatives are right and his Carbon Tax makes Canada a less competitive place to do business and that it will kill Canadian jobs. 4/n

This is after industry groups, business leaders, local operators, and families have argued for years that the Trudeau Carbon Tax will 1) kill jobs, 2) make life more expensive for Canadians, and 3) do absolutely nothing to actually help the environment. 3/n
We’re learning that Justin Trudeau’s Liberals are retreating. They’re trying to quietly “walk back” how much some large companies will have to pay under his new Carbon Tax. 2/n
Conservatives are winning the fight against Justin Trudeau’s Carbon tax. Some thoughts on today’s news… 1/n

Ma première mesure comme premier ministre sera d’abolir la taxe sur le carbone de Justin Trudeau. Le Canada doit être ouvert aux affaires. Nous devons créer des emplois et des possibilités pour tous les Canadiens. Et ensemble, nous pouvons le faire. 10/10

Les mauvaises politiques de Justin Trudeau rendent les affaires et la création d’emplois plus difficiles au Canada. En conséquence, un gros panneau ‘Fermé’ pend sur un pays qui était l’un des meilleurs endroits du monde où faire des affaires. 9/n

Trudeau a aussi créé une incertitude réglementaire massive, il augmente les charges sociales, il présente et – ne nous leurrons pas, va imposer – une taxe sur le carbone et il accuse des déficits générationnels massifs. 8/n
Le problème de compétitivité du Canada est le résultat direct des mauvaises politiques économiques de Justin Trudeau, dont la taxe sur le carbone n’est malheureusement qu’un exemple. 7/n

La réalité (bien sûr) est que la taxe sur le carbone de Trudeau est mauvaise pour tout le monde. Elle rend le Canada moins concurrentiel pour les affaires, que vous employiez 5 ou 50 000 personnes. Elle rend la vie plus chère pour les particuliers et les familles. 6/n

Mais il veut imposer sa taxe sur le carbone aux petites entreprises et aux familles. Ça n’a aucun sens. La taxe sur le carbone de Trudeau ne peut pas nuire aux grosses entreprises tout en aidant les petites entreprises et les familles. Mais c’est maintenant sa position. 5/n
Trudeau reconnaît aujourd’hui que les conservateurs ont raison et que sa taxe sur le carbone fera du Canada un endroit moins concurrentiel pour les affaires et éliminera des emplois canadiens. 4/n

Après que des groupes industriels, des chefs d’entreprise, des exploitants locaux et des familles disent depuis des années que la taxe sur le carbone de Trudeau 1) va tuer des emplois, 2) va rendre la vie plus chère et 3) ne fera absolument rien pour aider l’environnement. 3/n
Nous apprenons que les libéraux de Justin Trudeau font marche arrière. Ils tentent de « réduire » discrètement ce que de grosses entreprises vont payer avec sa taxe sur le carbone. 2/n
Les conservateurs gagnent la lutte contre la taxe sur le carbone de Justin Trudeau. Certaines réflexions aux nouvelles d’aujourd’hui… 1/n

Before Justin Trudeau became Prime Minister, energy projects were built without taxpayer support. Now he would have us believe that it is the only way for them to go forward. That is a terrible indictment of his own record. 7/7
He has emboldened and empowered protesters and pipeline opponents by claiming that they must grant permission before projects can proceed. /6

He vetoed Northern Gateway even though it had been approved by an independent scientific review panel. He killed Energy East by imposing new regulations that do not apply to foreign energy imports and do not apply to any other sector in Canada. /5
It is essential to remember that the reason why the stakes are so high around Trans Mountain is because Justin Trudeau has killed the other major pipelines that have been proposed. /4
Serious question for the Liberals: Is Justin Trudeau now admitting that under his watch the only way for pipelines to be built is by nationalizing them? /3
Why did it take so long for Trudeau to even meet with Premier Horgan? How much damage has he done to the confidence in our economy by waiting until now? /2
Remember: The Trans Mountain issue has become a crisis because Justin Trudeau has done literally nothing for months. Now Trudeau wants to be thanked for addressing a crisis he himself created. /1

Avant que Justin Trudeau devienne premier ministre, les projets énergétiques étaient réalisés sans le soutien des contribuables. Il veut maintenant nous faire croire que c’est le seul moyen d’aller de l’avant. C’est une terrible mise en accusation de son bilan d’échecs. 7/7
Il encourage les militants et les opposants aux pipelines en soutenant qu’il doit avoir une permission avant que des projets puissent être réalisés. /6

Il a imposé son veto à Northern Gateway même s’il avait été approuvé par un panel d’examen scientifique indépendant. Il a détruit Énergie Est en imposant de nouvelles règles qui ne s’appliquent pas aux importations de pétrole étranger et aux autres secteurs du Canada. /5
Il est primordial de se souvenir que la raison pour laquelle l’enjeu de Trans Mountain est si élevé est que Trudeau a détruit les autres projets majeurs qui avaient été proposés. /4
Grave question pour les libéraux: Est-ce que Justin Trudeau reconnaît maintenant que sous sa gouverne, la seule façon de construire des pipelines est de les nationaliser? /3
Pourquoi a-t-il fallu tant de temps pour que Trudeau rencontre le premier ministre Horgan? Dans quelle mesure a-t-il miné la confiance envers notre économie en attendant jusqu’à maintenant? /2

Quand les marchés fixent des coûts selon l’offre et la demande et que nous pouvons acheter un produit, c’est un prix. Quand le gouvernement fixe des coûts, oblige le paiement et prend l’argent, c’est une taxe. Toutes les manipulations libérales ne changent rien à ce fait.pic.twitter.com/k6i1pQNQuj

When the market sets costs based on supply and demand, and the freedom to purchase an item or not, that’s a price. When the government sets costs, forces collection, and takes the money into its coffers, that’s a tax. All the Liberal spin in the world doesn’t change this.pic.twitter.com/21OY7zjdzR

Today, Manitobans across the province celebrate Louis Riel Day. As a founder of the province and a prominent Canadian politician of Métis background, this holiday presents an opportunity to learn more about Métis people's culture and heritage.

Our family is our strength! Today, I hope everyone celebrating Family Day gets to spend quality time with their loved ones. This is an opportunity to enjoy each other’s company, bond and reflect on the importance of family in our lives. Happy Family Day!

Notre famille est notre force! Aujourd’hui, nous célébrons la Journée de la famille et passons du bon temps avec nos proches. C’est une occasion de profiter de la compagnie des autres et de réfléchir à l’importance de la famille dans notre vie. Bonne Journée de la famille!

Aujourd’hui, la Nouvelle-Écosse célèbre le Jour du patrimoine. Cette fête rappelle la fière histoire de la N.-É. et souligne les possibilités que la province offre à ses résidents. C’est aussi une journée pour réfléchir aux réalisations des vaillants habitants de la province.

Today, Nova Scotia celebrates Heritage Day. This holiday serves as a great reminder of Nova Scotia’s proud history and celebrates the opportunities this province has to offer to its residents. This is also a day to reflect on the achievements of hard-working Nova Scotians.

En cette Fête des insulaires, les résidants de l’Île-du-Prince-Édouard se rassemblent pour célébrer l’importance de la famille dans nos vies. C’est une formidable occasion de passer du temps avec notre famille et de lui montrer notre gratitude. Bonne Fête des insulaires!

God bless Canada.
And I know that by working together, we can achieve that critical first step. We can make sure that Justin Trudeau is a one term Prime Minister!
So all of us working together, can build a Canada that works, a country they will love as we love it,and one of which they will for all their lives be proud to say, “I am a Canadian.”

A Canada of hope, and opportunity. Now, it will take all of us to do this. Each and everyone one of has to do our part. We need to re-win those arguments. All of us, in every walk of life, in every level of government have to win over a new generation of Canadians.
Un pays qui n’est pas affaibli par la dette, et par le lourd contrôle du gouvernement, mais un Canada motivé par l’espoir… et renforcé par la liberté.

We know it is a privilege to do our duty for our children and our grandchildren, to go out and build for them a good place. To build on a foundation left to us by the generations that came before, rather than constantly being ashamed by it.

Et le monde a appris, une fois de plus, une précieuse leçon : attention aux gouvernements qui aiment le pouvoir, qui veulent contrôler les pensées et les idées. Ils n’aiment pas que les gens montrent qu’ils ne sont pas d’accord avec eux et deviennent pires, pas meilleurs.

In the end, that’s what we Conservatives want to achieve: freedom, and greater opportunity for all. Freedom is a government that lets the free market work, that keeps taxes and spending under control. Opportunity that makes it possible for everyone to get ahead.

Nous allons profiter des nouvelles circonstances mondiales pour défendre la prospérité que le commerce nous apporte, avec d’autres pays qui partagent le rêve de gens libres qui prennent des décisions librement.
It’s not enough for Conservatives to criticize. We need to show we have a better idea. Our plans need to be clear.

So today, I’m making you the first to know. Canada’s Conservatives will pursue a free trade deal with the United Kingdom when we form government in 2019. Moreover, I’ll be taking the initiative to promote this idea when I travel to the United Kingdom later this spring.

Nous ne devrions pas oublier nos valeurs de libre-échange, mais les défendre plus que jamais. Nous devons répéter sans cesse que les obstacles commerciaux entre le Canada et ses alliés font plus de mal que de bien.

C’est un héritage conservateur. Nous sommes le parti du libre-échange. Nous sommes le parti de l’ALENA. Aujourd’hui, nous voyons que notre ordre du jour commercial est en difficulté. L’avenir est incertain.
We will stand with Israel and Ukraine – and we will stand for the rights and dignity of peoples everywhere – for the right to be free, to choose your own government, and to express your opinions.
A Conservative government under Andrew Scheer will return Canada to being a principled voice on the world stage.
My recent private member’s bill, the Supporting New Parents Act, will give new parents up to $4000 a year to help adjust to life with a new family.

. @MaximeBernier tabled a bill that will shine a light onto corporate welfare and force the government to disclose whether or not companies that have received sweetheart loans have actually paid them back.
My colleague @PierrePoilievre put forward a private members bill that supports workers with disabilities.

Now, all of us know that, as Conservatives, it is simply not enough to speak our values, but to have a plan to back them up. And in the weeks and months to come, Canda’s Conservatives will be putting forward our vision for putting people before government.

The history of the past several decades is a glorious confirmation of what can be achieved when people are free to build, free to create, and free to find innovative solutions to problems, without the interference of bureaucrats who think they know better.

La différence est qu’à un moment, on doit arrêter de parler et AGIR. Sortir et se mettre au travail, accordant ses idées pour un Canada meilleur avec les réalités souvent complexes et difficiles de la vie de tous les jours.
Not because we’ve given up on the dream of a better world, but because the lessons of history prove that coercive governments invariably make the world worse.

This study of history teaches conservatives humility. It teaches us to appreciate how fortunate we are in this great country. It warns us how quickly that good fortune can be squandered. It teaches us that there must be limits to government’s power over the lives of individuals.

It’s always bothered me: When we become conservatives, we don’t lose our hearts. We still want the world to be a better place. Greener, cleaner, more just, more prosperous, for men, for women, for people who work hard and play by the rules, for our children, for other Canadians.
But Conservatives need to remind Canadians that the Liberals have no exclusive monopoly on compassion. But real compassion is what Conservatives do.

To understand what Liberals think, you don’t listen to what they say. You look at what they do. They will tell you it’s all for our own good. The Liberals are always so good at wrapping themselves up in the idea that they are full of compassion.
Quelle relation les libéraux veulent que les Canadiens aient avec leur gouvernement? Allons-nous faire passer les gens avant le gouvernement? Le gouvernement va-t-ilappartenir aux Canadiens?

Appease violent dictators and despotic regimes? I thought we had learned that lesson too, in the 1930s. Suppress free speech to protect people’s feelings? I thought we had learned that lesson in the 19th century.
Make no mistake – in the ideological conflict, it took conservatives, with their commitment to freedom, democracy, and human dignity, to win the day.
In those years, Conservatives in the west unshackled our economy, and they demonstrated the steadfastness and fortitude to sacrifice in the fight for freedom. And they won.

There was something else that distinguished the world that I grew up in - it was a world in which the failures of big government intrusion into the economy and into peoples’ lives were on clear display.
It’s not just a contest between left and right. It’s about being free, or unfree.
We all saw the depth of their mean-spiritedness last week, when the Prime Minister scolded Canada’s veterans for asking for more than the government was able to give.

The trouble with the Liberal leadership is that they just live in a different world. Meanwhile in a stunningly cruel piece of generational kneecapping, these same people will run up debts for our grandchildren to pay off, even as they pretend to champion the middle class.

Local business is the backbone and the heart of the Canadian economy. Yet, instead of gratitude, instead of respect, the Liberals treat them as cheats who use their businesses to avoid paying their fair share of taxes.
Je peux vous dire que je ne pourrais pas être plus fier de notre caucus: nous demandons des comptes aux libéraux de la bonne façon.
Vous vous demandez peut-être pourquoi je suis si sûr que nous allons former un gouvernement conservateur l’année prochaine.

There are obviously different reasons why people join our movement. But I believe that there are certain core principles that we can all agree on. Conservativism emphasizes individual and political freedom, free trade, and the universal benefits of a free economy.

After a weekend of nomination meetings, the list of Conservative candidates for the four by-elections has now been finalized. In Battlefords-Lloydminster, @rosemarie_falk has been nominated to represent the party.
On World Diabetes Day, let’s make sure we’re doing all we can for those living with diabetes in Canada and around the world. 4/4
This tax credit helps some of the most vulnerable Canadians manage their condition, but the Liberal government has been denying the benefit to many against the advice of doctors. 3/4

With access to affordable treatments, diabetes is manageable. But in recent weeks, Conservatives have been raising the alarm over the government restricting access to the Disability Tax Credit for Canadians living with Type 1 diabetes. 2/4

This is #WorldDiabetesDay, the world’s biggest awareness campaign for those affected by Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes. This year brings a special focus on women and diabetes, with over 199 million women around the world living with a form of diabetes. 1/4
En cette Journée mondiale du diabète, assurons-nous que nous mettons tout en œuvre pour ceux qui vivent avec le diabète au Canada et dans le monde entier. 4/4
Ce crédit d’impôt aide certains des Canadiens les plus vulnérables à gérer leur maladie, mais le gouvernement libéral refuse cet avantage à de nombreuses personnes malgré le conseil des médecins. 3/4

Avec un accès à des traitements abordables, le diabète peut être géré. Mais ces dernières semaines, les conservateurs ont sonné l’alarme parce que le gouvernement limite l’accès au Crédit d’impôt pour invalidité pour les Canadiens souffrant de diabète de type 1. 2/4

C’est la #JournéeMondialeDuDiabete, la plus importante campagne de sensibilisation mondiale aux personnes souffrant de diabète de type 1 et 2. Cette année est axée sur les femmes et le diabète, plus de 199 millions de femmes dans le monde vivant avec une forme de diabète. 1/4

Announcing a Conservative Gov't under my leadership will advocate for, and lead, a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine. https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/1790293944337683/ …pic.twitter.com/cJDk3ZFRH2

Un gouvernement conservateur sous mon leadership défendra et dirigera une mission de maintien de la paix en Ukraine: https://www.facebook.com/AndrewScheerMP/videos/1790293944337683/ …pic.twitter.com/b4tg1i8xqv
It would allow Ukraine to restore control over its eastern border with Russia, ensuring the Russian military stays within its own country, and out of Ukraine.
This mission would cover the entire Donbas region in Ukraine, necessitating the withdrawal of the Russian military and its proxies from Ukrainian territory.
It is time for Canada to take the lead again.
This is why Conservatives support Canada’s leadership and participation in a United Nations peacekeeping mission in eastern Ukraine, in accordance with the requests made by the Ukrainian government.

Any deployment of Canadian soldiers as peacekeepers must be consistent with our interests, our values, and in keeping with our greatest traditions of offering a hand to those seeking peace, freedom and security.
From day one, Conservatives have been clear: any deployment has to be in Canada’s national interests. This possible peacekeeping mission is not a means to win a UN Security Council seat at any cost.

The Trudeau Liberals have been promising to choose a mission since they took office. But after two years, they appear no closer to a decision. They’ve made great promises to our Allies, and then left them waiting.

Making an important announcement this afternoon: a Conservative Government under my leadership will advocate for, and lead, a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine to ensure Ukrainian sovereignty against Russian aggression.
